Articles.Content:
![title.jpg](http://www.whoshotdk.co.uk/KSP/Ships/SPH/TenPin/title.jpg)

Best played on a flat surface (i.e Runway) by two players.

A video paints a thousand pictures so;

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ta04xXITORg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[DOWNLOAD](http://www.whoshotdk.co.uk/KSP/Ships/SPH/TenPin/TenPin.craft)

You might need to right-click that link and use 'Save As' or similar.

CONTROLS

[0] Release pins (do this at start of play)

[1] Lane 1, Ball 1 Release

[5] Lane 1, Ball 1 Bowl / Shoot

[2] Lane 1, Ball 2 Release

[6] Lane 1, Ball 3 Bowl / Shoot

[3] Lane 2, Ball 1 Release

[7] Lane 2, Ball 2 Bowl / Shoot

[4] Lane 2, Ball 2 Release

[8] Lane 2, Ball 2 Bowl / Shoot

NOTES

You can turn your ball after bowling it, though itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s (intentionally) difficult to aim ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Release each ball before you bowl it. DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t release them all at once as they have a tendency to roll along the lane.

Switching vessels through all those pins is a PITA, so:

After releasing your ball, switch *back* a vessel generally takes you straight to it.

After your bowl, switching *forward* once *or* twice generally takes you back to the game vessel so you can release the next ball.

This applied to me anyway, with no other vessels in range of the play area.

**Have fun and leave me some love (rep) if you like!**

Allow me to quote Rune, 

"Kerbal Whatever Program"

Once Multiplayer is implemented, this will be the best thing to do in KSP.
"You must spread some Reputation around before giving it to whoshotdk again"

> 
> "You must spread some Reputation around before giving it to whoshotdk again"

Ikr...

But anyway, Kerbal Whatever Program continues!
This gives me an idea, Kerbal what ever program it is!
You guys are too kind - thanks for all the love!
[suggestion]: Use Infernal Robotics. With a gantry you'll be able to move the 'ball' from side to side and the rotators will let you aim.
